result.execSummary:
The defendant William R. Lamb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Forgery-Writings or Objects [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Nelson - no additions or corrections

State - argues sentence - PSI writer is in courtroom - probation appropriate - 1 yr jail cond time
Nelson objects to argument about Law license
COURT:  objection overruled
State - continued argument
Nelson - objects to prior conviction(s)
State - continued argument
Nelson - argues sentence
Deft - addresses the court

COURT:  Voter ineligibility form given to deft to sign in Court
Restitution not an issue

pay statutory costs

no alcohol; possession or consumption
follow all recommendations, evaluation and complete counseling

pay statutory costs

Jail - 6 months - concurrent - huber allowed for work, treatment
no alcohol - same as above
assessments and follow thru
ineligible to vote form given to deft and return to COC

if after 18 months he can apply for early discharge and paid off all obligations and okay from agent

Jury Trial-July 16, 2015

Defendant, William R. Lamb with Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Jay.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:24)
State - defense will stipulate that he signed R. M.'s name on back of check (part of Exh 5 & 9)
Nelson - stips to State amending of Ct 2 to forgery
Court - goes over amendment of Ct 2 to simple forgery with defendant - deft approves of amendment - stipulates that he did sign R.M.'s name on back of check
State - goes over jury instructions - moves to amend to conform with the truth
Nelson - objects the amendment
State - rebuttal of amendment
COURT:  finds that the deft is not duly surprised of change - State is not adding counts - it continues to be allegations of taking funds from his client - law allows that the change can be done to conform to the truth - amply proof to amend or conform the information on Ct 1 and it is not prejudicial to the deft and grants the State's request to file an 3rd amended Ct 1 and that will be the Ct along with Ct 2 that will go to the jury
Nelson - argues - the amendment doesn't change the date
State - as long as it's on or about that date
COURT:  will leave the "on or about" date for counsel to argue to the jury
(9:01)  break until 9:05 - Court will address the changes to the Counts
(9:09)  Jurors enter courtroom - Court goes over the changes with Ct 1 & 2 and parties stipulation to deft's signing R. M.'s name on back of settlement check
State calls Kris Wenzel - sworn
State offers Exh 6 - Wenzel's file - Nelson objects as to side bar discussion - received
State requests court take judicial notice of date - no objection by Nelson
Cross by Nelson 
Redirect by State
Nelson requests discussion on sidebar
(9:49)  jurors excused until 10:00
Nelson argues part of Exh 6 not given to jurors
State - no objection
COURT:  approves the stipulation of parties of Exh 6
(10:02)  jurors enter courtroom
State recalls Inv. Pellett - sworn
State references Exh 5
Cross by Nelson
Redirect by State
Recross by Nelson
Witness excused
State rests
(10:30) jurors excused until approx 11:00 - counsel remain
Nelson addresses 3rd amended information - in Ct 1 the "to wit:" in the 2nd amended & 3rd amended
State - it's consistent with the discovery
COURT:  was aware of the charge and doesn't change it's earlier ruling and it conforms to the truth
Nelson -  moves to Dismiss Ct 1 and moves for a directed verdict
(10:35)  break 5 minutes
(10:45)  back on record outside presence of jury - on defense, motion State has met it's burden on Ct 1 - denies deft's motion
Nelson - defense plans to call Mr. Lamb as witness - he's waiving his right to remain silent
Court goes over right to testify - finds his willingness to testify is made freely & voluntarily and understands his rights
State - argues any discussion to penalties
(10:57)  recess for 5-10 minutes
(11:08)  back on record in presence of jury 
Nelson calls William Lamb - sworn
Nelson requests publishing of Exh 9 to jurors - no objection - Court grants publishing of Exh 9
Nelson references Exh 5
Sidebar taken
(11:45)  jurors excused for addtl discussion
Nelson - requests Lamb be excused during arguments
State - no objection but should be Lambs decision
Court - addresses rights of him to be present
Lamb - comfortable to step out in the hall 
Court - determines he voluntarily agreed to step out in the hallway during argument
State - argues procedural change
Nelson - response
State - rebuttal
COURT:  will review arguments over lunch 
(12:10)  break for lunch until 12:55
(12:58)  back on record outside presence of jurors
Court - addresses issues raised by Mr. Nelson - objection sustained re: his disease of alcoholism
Discussion of instructions
Nelson argues
Nothing further from State
(1:05)  Jurors enter courtroom - continued direct examination by Nelson of Mr. Lamb
(1:24)  Cross by State
(1:35)  Jurors excused for 5 minutes
Nelson argues reference to investigation by Inv. Pellett
State argues
Nelson argues "Right to Remain Silent"
(1:42)  break taken 5 - 10 minutes
(1:53)  back on record outside presence of jury
Court - agrees with Mr. Nelson - will not allow state to ask any questions on investigation on deft's silence
(1:56)  jurors enter courtroom - continued cross by State
(1:59)  redirect by Nelson
(2:01)  Defense rests 
No rebuttal testimony
(2:03)  jurors excused
(2:03)  Nelson moves for dismissal
(2:05)  State argues
COURT:  denies deft's motion to dismiss
counsel go over instructions & verdict forms
COURT:  Guilty Verdict form on Ct 1 add - jurors to determine if it was up to $5,000 or $10,000
Nelson argues portion of that money was Mr. Lambs
State rebuttal
COURT:  allows both denomination forms to be spoke & $10,500 to remain
Nelson - requests the first reading of the verdict forms be not guilty
State - requests they are read as they are set up
COURT:  will read them as they are set up - will include the statute in all the verdict form
(3:06)  break taken to update jury instructions & verdict forms
(3:36)  back on record out of presence of jurors - counsel go over instructions
(3:41)  jurors enter courtroom
(3:42)  Court gives final instructions
  Vickie Girard - Clerk
(3:58) State gives closing arguments
(4:13) Atty Nelson gives closing arguments
(4:54) State gives rebuttal
(4:59) Court gives final instructions
(5:05) Bailiff sworn in
(5:07)  Jurors excused
Recess taken
(5:30) Back on the record - court received the first question 
Atty Nelson indicates it is Ex #5
State does not object to jurors having this exhibit
(5:34) Recess taken
(5:52) Court back on the record
(5:54) Jurors enter courtroom
Court asks if verdict reached. Foreperson hands verdict and exhibit to bailiff to give to court.
Court reads the verdict - guilty of theft in ct 1, followup questions -value of money more than $5,000 - yes  value of money more than $10,000 - yes
guilty of ct 2 forgery - 
Court polls the jury
(5:59) Court excuses jury from courtroom.
Court - Enters judgment of conviction on both counts 1 & 2.  Orders pre-sentence investigation to be prepared. Judicial assitant will contact both council next week for sentencing.  Bond continues.

Defendant, William R. Lamb with Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Jay.  Patty Kehne clerk.  Case called at 8:54 AM.  In-chambers conference held with attorneys prior to commencement of trial.  Preliminary instructions discussed.  No objections.  Individual voir dire discussed with individual jurors being addressed in Chambers.  No objection by Defendant.  Second amended information received upon stipulation of parties.  Sequestration requested and so Ordered by court.   Objection of Court Officer by Defense.  Court finds that Officer David Pellett is an essential person, as an agent of the Plaintiff, can be present.  Newspaper articles discussed, individual voir dire may be necessary.  Judges addresses voir dire.  Aaron Nelson re-addresses the Court.  Motion in Limine discussed.    Rebuttal, jury instruction 1444.    Other acts brief discussed.  Other acts inadmissible and will be argued at a later time.  The use of "attorney" when referring to the Defendant.   Motion in Limine discussed.   Jurors enter at 9:18.  Court addresses Jurors.   There will be no alternates.  Oath administered to entire jury panel at 9:23.     Parties introduced.   Jurors #67 and #8.  knows Defendant.  #8 excused for cause.  #44 called - related by blood and excused.  #36 called.  Witness list discussed,  Juror #4 read newspaper articles about the Defendant prior to today.  Elements of case discussed.    9:47 - Annie Jay addresses jury pool.  10:10 Aaron Nelson addresses the jury pool.  Brief recess taken.  Back on the record at 10:48.  Court addresses jurors.  Strikes taken. Panel chosen and list presented to Judge at 11:20.  Oath administered to jurors chosen.  Recess taken at 11:25.    On the record outside of the jury.  First witness will be taken after lunch.  Opening before lunch.  Opening acts discussed.  Court believes adequate notice was given to Defense re: charges.  Defendant's motion is denied.  Court will consider evidence and testimony re: post-transfer.    Back on the record in the presence of the jury -- 11:46.   Opening by both parties.  Court addresses jurors.  Recess
